channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Lots of large pot holes off roundabout, 12th January
item.description:
Massive and multiple potholes staight of roundabout. Very harsh on my car. Damaged wheel.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 2 Alma Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Water meter inspection hatch presenting trip hazard, 12th January
item.description:
The water meter inspection hatch outside 14 Millfields is not sitting flush in the ground - looks like it has come away from the surrounding tarmac. I would suggest that it is rectified as a matter of priority - it could easily be tripped over. If someone did trip and hurt themselves I would be prepared to be a witness for them in any claim they made that I had reported the problem.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 14 Millfields, Hucclecote
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Huge potholes in varios locations, 12th January
item.description:
Made worse by the recent heavy rain.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 15 Wessex Drive, Charlton Kings
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: My husband doing Gloucestershire highways job, 12th January
item.description:
This keeps happening they don’t clean the drains on a main busy Road, so when it rains heavily the Road floods as in danger of flooding houses. The rain was up to our door and if my husband had not been in to rush out, as seen in photo out house would have been flooded. This happens a lot and the rain water is washing away our wall. I have reported this many times

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 279 Cirencester Road, Charlton Kings
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Deep and Wide Pothole, 12th January
item.description:
New deep pothole opened up next to the one that was filled in on Monday on this one way section of Church street, fairly close to the Copt Elm junction. It is now so large that vehicles are not able to avoid it on this narrow road, and it is increasing in size rapidly each day. Cars swerving and using the pavement to avoid are a danger to pedestrians including children going to the nearby schools.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 1 Church Street, Charlton Kings
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Various sizes of potholes on Gloucester Old Rd near new build development, 11th January
item.description:
Various sized potholes on both sides of carriageway, the potholes have been here since early last year and are getting bigger and deeper. I use this road everyday to my commute to work and I’m concerned that they will eventually damage mine and others cars
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Old Gloucester Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Wheel killer, 11th January
item.description:
Nasty pothole. Caused damage to car severe enough to now be unsafe to drive.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 257 Hatherley Road, Cheltenham

item.title: Deep pot hole on the roundabout, 11th January
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 1 Buccaneer Avenue, Brockworth

item.title: Traffic lights change to red too quickly, 11th January
item.description:
These traffic lights change from green to red in 2 seconds, which is too quickly if travelling at 60mph speed limit requiring hard braking, the light change needs slowing down
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): A40, Andoversford
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Several deep and dangerous pot holes on Linworth Road, Bishops Cleeve, Gl528PB., 11th January
item.description:
Several deep and dangerous pot holes outside no. 2 to approx no. 10 Linworth Road, Bishops Cleeve, Gl528PB. They have been there for months. They have been filled in with gravel at some point and the gravel is all over the road flicking up and hitting vehicles as they go by. It’s a highly used road with many buses and trade vans.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Two Hedges Road, Woodmancote
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flooded road outside primary school, 11th January
item.description:
Please clean these drains before my son and I get soaked again. They need cleaning out much more often than happens.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 1 Boleyn Cottages Church Road, Swindon Village
Report on FixMyStreet
